text: In Naples it is customary to bring a coffee and pay more than you consume. For example, four people enter, sit down, order four coffees and say, “And three more in suspense.” After a while, a poor man comes to the door and asks: “Is there any coffee in the cupboard?” The employee looks at the register of the antecedents, checks the entry and says “Yes”. The poor enter, drink coffee and go, I suppose thanking the charity. FIN
title: Café en suspenso
author: José Saramago
